Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Hatchling
boardgame.description:
HATCHLING is a solo journaling RPG where you play as a freshly hatched sea turtle in a dark and confusing world beyond your comprehension and full of danger and new experiences. Safety is the ocean, but your chances of getting there are slim to none.

You push hard and a crack opens before your eyes. There’s something out there! You heave and push, working your muscles properly for the first time, and after minutes of struggling and cracking away at the shell, you burst free of your egg and onto the ground. You’ve successfully hatched!

You’ve never been there before, but you can feel in your bones that you need to get to the ocean. But…
Where is it? What is this place?
Lights! Scratchy ground!
So very hungry...
A strange sound!

Oh no… which way?

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Rajas of the Ganges: Folded Space Insert
boardgame.description:
This insert is compatible with Rajas of the Ganges, including the Goodie Box 1 (Rajas of the Ganges: Mango Village, Rajas of the Ganges: Snake Expansion and Rajas of the Ganges: Tiger Expansion) and Goodie Box 2 (Rajas of the Ganges: Blessings of Kedarnath) expansions.

The design provides both efficient storage and improved game play.

Many of the trays can be utilised during the game, and they greatly aid set-up and clear-away times.

The insert includes trays for storing and organising all of the game components. Each player has their own player tray for their game pieces.

The trays are arranged in two layers. There are two filler trays provided to fill the box and holds the boards in place.

Note that there are four long trays for the province tiles, with four slots in each. This means that the cow, snake and tiger provinces can be stored separately and simply placed by the board during setup.

When packing the box, first place the main game board on top of the insert trays. The oval mango tree tile is placed inside one of the filler trays. Next place the province boards on top of the board, followed by the kali statue boards, brown-yield tile and small road board as shown. Lastly place the rule books on top of the boards.

This fully fills the box and allows for vertical storage of the game.

Note: Insert designed for game with external box dimensions of 29.5 x 29.5 x 7.3 cm.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Rajas of the Ganges: Blessings of Kedarnath
Rajas of the Ganges: Goodie Box 1
Rajas of the Ganges: Goodie Box 2
Rajas of the Ganges: Mango Village
Rajas of the Ganges: Snake Expansion
Rajas of the Ganges: Tiger Expansion

listing.notes: Title: Folded Space Organizer: Rajas of the Ganges Insert Publisher: Folded Space

boardgame.name: The Case Of The Neat MacGuffin
boardgame.description:
The Case Of The Neat MacGuffin is a solo RPG played with a deck of cards, a tumbling block tower, paper and a pen.

It’s been weeks since your last case. Your wallet’s beginning to hold more air than banknotes and your liquor cabinet is beginning to look dangerously empty. You’ve spent many hours digging through the papers and making calls but no-one seems to want your services.

But then, one night there was a knock at your door.

She was beautiful; a drop dead gorgeous blonde with legs that reached all the way down to the floor. She entered the room with style, sliding gracefully into a chair with an uncomfortable squeak that reminded you it was probably about time to replace it with a new one.

There was no small talk. No, it was all big. She desperately needed a detective and you were the first name in the phonebook.

The Neat MacGuffin was missing and the lady suspected foul play. She needed it found and she needed it found fast. There wasn’t much to go by - a couple of names, a vague description, but it was enough to start an investigation.

“So,” she asked. “Will you take the case or not?”

You pause, just long enough to unnecessarily increase the suspense, then nod.


Source: The Developer Website.
boardgame.rpg: The Case of the Neat MacGuffin

boardgame.name: Mating Season
boardgame.description:
Mating Season is played with a set of 36 insect cards/tiles. Each card is a unique combination of one of six colors, one of three wing patterns, and having or not having antennae. The cards are double-sided, with a male on one side and a female on the other.

In the two-player game players start with five-card "hands" (the cards are actually face-up on the table) and a single card to start a common insect family tree. Players take turns playing one or more cards to the tree; before playing a player may draw up to five more cards from the deck, choosing their genders.

Two insects will only mate if they are of different genders, of complementary colors, have different wing patterns, and have opposite antenna status. Their offspring (up to two) will have the wing pattern different from either parent's and any of the other four colors.

There can only be five generations in play; if a sixth is started the top one is shuffled and placed at the bottom of the deck.

The first player to empty their hand wins.

In the solitaire game an insect is set aside at the start and the goal is to evolve a mate for it within five generations.

boardgame.name: Bayamigo
boardgame.description:
Bayamigo is a game about buying and reselling fruit and vegetables in local markets. The goal is to achieve the greatest profit of all players, surviving unexpected obstacles in transport and price levels while facing fierce competition from other players.
Bayamigo is played over three days (different lengths can be agreed on). At the beginning of each day, players buy goods in bulk, and rent motorcycles or vans for the transport. Then they begin a journey through different markets. At each market, players can announce that they want to sell goods there. All players who want to sell, pay the required tax, then dice are rolled to determine the selling price. Each market has a maximum capacity, so turn order is important. Players who are not happy with the price can move on, but won’t get their taxes back. At the end of the day, vehicles have to be returned, and interest has to be paid on any debts the players may have. Obstacle cards can get in your way, reflecting the risks that small-scale resellers face in their trade.
The player who has made the greatest profit during the three days, wins the game.

boardgame.name: The Mariner
boardgame.description:
The Mariner is a solo RPG played with a deck of cards, a tumbling block tower, paper and a pen.

“Day after day, day after day,
We stuck, nor breath nor motion;
As idle as a painted ship
Upon a painted ocean.
Water, water, every where,
And all the boards did shrink;
Water, water, every where,
Nor any drop to drink.”


You don’t know what possessed you to shoot that bird. Perhaps you believed the old sailor’s tales of bad omens, of spectral birds with the power to bring bad weather and seas upon helpless ships. Maybe you wanted to prove to the crew that as the captain you weren’t afraid of superstition, or perhaps you were just tired of watching the albatross endlessly circle above you, round and round, for hour upon hour.

Whatever your reasoning, your crossbow shot didn’t miss. The bird fell from the sky like a stone, crashed into the ocean and for a time you thought nothing further of it. Then the winds dropped and the sea lay still. Hours became days with your sails lying slack. Without wind or current your vessel drifted, a prisoner upon a flat glass ocean.

Provisions grow fewer by the day and the men are restless and impatient. As the captain of the ship, your responsibility is to keep the men in line and morale high, but as days pass, you begin to hear more and more whispers. You killed the bird. You brought this fate upon the ship.

How long will the winds not blow? How long will your men wait without food, without fresh water and without hope?

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Extraordinary Voyages and Halcyon Days
boardgame.description:
You’ve been studying this language for ages. Now, it’s time to visit an imaginary foreign land where they speak that language, and record all of your experiences there...all from the comfort of your own home!

Sit back, relax, and enjoy sun-dappled vistas and bustling marketplaces from the power of your imagination. Stretch your linguistic limits and teach yourself new words using guiding prompts in a journal chronicling your vacation to a fictional country. Extraordinary Voyages and Halcyon Days is a Wretched and Alone hack for self-guided intermediate language students.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: This Wretched Hunt of Mine
boardgame.description:
You are a lone hunter in some remote and inhospitable place, hunting down a terrible and dangerous monster.

The monster has taken something from you. Something important, something irreplaceable. You have vowed to kill it, even if its the last thing you do in this life.

But, the monster knows you are following them and is far more clever than you could have imagined...

You are alone and at your wits end, quickly realizing that you are unlikely to survive this ordeal. Your supplies are dwindling, the place is dangerous, and all the while the monster waits for a time to strike.

Can you survive this place or will you succumb to its hardships? Are your wits and supplies enough or were they all for naught? Will you defeat the monster or will it destroy you, mind, body, and soul?

You must at least try...

This Wretched Hunt of Mine is a journal game about horror, survival, isolation and grit.

To play you’ll need:

• A journal to record daily entries
• A deck of cards with no jokers
• A 6-sided die
• A tumbling block tower
• 10 tokens of some kind, preferably a collection of bones, stone, or beads

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Escape(Dot)Gov
boardgame.description:
Escape(Dot)Gov is a solo journaling RPG, made using the Wretched & Alone rules by Chris Bissette and Matt Sanders.

You are the greatest leader of the greatest country on the greatest planet in the entire world. At least, that's what you tell everyone. Your self-serving interests have ruined the ecosystem and destabilized the atmosphere, and with dissenters calling for your head, it's time to leave.

There is no escape for you on Earth. Can you build a colony ship and rig the Escape(Dot)Gov lottery to secure your own survival and outrun the consequences of your actions against the planet and its people before your schemes are revealed and your administration is dissolved?

Escape(Dot)Gov is meant to be a nearly impossible game satirizing the struggle to escape your guilt and treachery as a megalomaniacal leader whose time is running out. For those seeking alternate themes or a more positive outlook, alternate rules are included for Escape(Dot)Org: an experience from the perspective of the people after having overthrown this tyrannical leader, working together to build colony ships and offer a fair shot to everyone for the world to board while stabilizing the ailing planet.

For the experience as designed, this game requires a block tower, deck of cards, six-sided die, ten tokens of any kind, and a method of journaling or recording. Any or all of these requirements can be substituted as desired or needed. Enjoy the game!

Content warnings include gaslighting, dystopian and doomsday scenarios, narcissism, and public speaking. Please prioritize your mental health and adjust gameplay accordingly.


EscapeDotGov and EscapeDotOrg are not actual websites affiliated with this game*


Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: There's More to This House...
boardgame.description:
WHERE DID THAT DOOR COME FROM?

It wasn’t there when you fell asleep. But it appeared in the middle of your wall. Even though you just moved here with your family, you would have noticed it before. The door doesn’t feel safe, but your hand gravitates to the knob anyway.

It’s unlocked...

An impossible hallway extends into the darkness. You can’t see what’s at the end. Your family is terrified, but you’re curious about what lies in the depths of your home.

You plan your expedition.


There's More to This House... is a solo survival and mapmaking RPG played with a deck of cards, a tumbling block tower, two 6-sided dice, and graph paper.

You are a new homeowner that discovers their home is growing and expanding on the inside. Even though you sense danger deep within your home, you're drawn to explore the new hallways and rooms that appear. You are alone. You can’t communicate with your family, and they aren’t able to reach you. As you venture deeper, your mental stability cracks. It’s not likely you’ll survive, but something draws you deeper inside.

Note: There are heavy themes of hopelessness, isolation, gaslighting, and death. If you are not comfortable exploring any of these concepts, this may not be the game for you.

There’s More to This House... draws heavy inspiration from House of Leaves by Mark Z. Danielewski and short stories such as Brian Russell’s “NoEnd House” and Charlotte Bywater’s “Hidden Door”.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Unfeeded
boardgame.description:
You are a cat. It has been hours since you were last given any cat food. The people are not responding to your cries. You are going to starve and die -- all alone and unfeeded.

Unfeeded is a single-player game. To play, you will need one standard deck of cards, one six-sided die, five tokens, and some method for recording your story.

Created for the Wretched and Alone jam #WretchedJam

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: You are Alone
boardgame.description:
You are Alone.

The Asylum stands like a decaying monument to insanity, but still you ventured in.

Turn off the lights, light some candles and see if you can survive the night.

This is a solo journaling RPG about isolation and dwindling hope, intended to be played in the dark, Alone.

You are alone.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Below 459
boardgame.description:
The year is 1968. You find yourself aboard a damaged West German Type 205 U-Boat. You’ve set out for the Baltic Sea, keeping an eye on those socialists from the DDR just next door. Then, the incident happened.

Somehow, you are the only one who survived, the dead bodies of your Kameraden all around. The boat lays still on the sea floor, water dripping from the ceiling. You cannot escape and have to wait for the rescue team. To make yourself know, you have to find the Funkboje first and launch it to the surface to send an S.O.S. Until then, you have to survive, both physically and mentally.

Below 459 is a GM-less, solo journaling ttrpg played with a set of cards, a d6, and a tumbling tower.

---

Safety: This game includes themes of isolation, narrow spaces, despair, violence, death and ideological conflict.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Gamebook Zine (Issue 1 - Spring 2021)
boardgame.description:
Gamebook Zine

Issue #1, Spring 2021

Interactive Fiction Fanzine
Games, Artwork, Stories, Articles
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: How to Start Writing a Novel

boardgame.name: Dungeon Crawling with Style
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Exploration Ruleset. Immersive exploration rules.

Publisher's blurb:

Dungeon Crawling with Style works by replacing the current weight system for the Bulk system and adding a dungeon turn procedure to track time, resources, and random effects in dungeons.

The most fundamental change is that time becomes a valuable asset and a trading system for the characters' actions.

boardgame.name: The Mothman
boardgame.description:
From the description:

A nocturnal wanderer of the shattered world, a vile thing, seeking to snuff out any light that may be remaining.

boardgame.name: Devil's Camp
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Welcome to Devils Camp

Your home away from home. Everything you could ever want is here. Don't mind your aching bones. Keep dancing. Keep smiling. You don't need the outside world. You don't need food or drink. All you'll ever need is the song and the dance.

boardgame.name: Treasure Hunters
boardgame.description:
Treasure Hunters is played on a board of seven spaces arranged in a ring. The players move around this - one clockwise and one counterclockwise - picking up four different values of treasure.

Movement is done by playing cards - one player has all the black cards from a standard deck and the other has the red, with random hands drawn from each. Most cards move the player around the board, but court cards have special effects.

When a player lands on a space they take the least-valuable treasure there, generally speaking. At the end of a turn a player may turn over one treasure on the board; treasures that have been turned over are worth more.

When all the treasures have been taken or all cards have been played the player with the most points in treasures wins.

boardgame.name: Jitsu Squad
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).





Jitsu Squad is all about fast-paced cartoony action & wacky chaotic battles! It has the freedom & accessibility of games like Streets of Rage and Final Fight but with the speed & intensity of games such as Guilty Gear, Marvel vs Capcom II & Super Smash Bros.Special Features:

Epic Super Specials!
100+ chain-combos!
Powerful in-game character transformations!
Awesome crossover assist characters!
Run or Dash! No walking allowed in this game!
A wide variety of unique enemies and stages!
Up to 4-player co-op fun!
Unique secondary weapons for each playable character!
Upgrade system to level up your character!


Source: The Kickstarter.

boardgame.name: ASL Comp: GWASL XI – Balkan Aspirations: Romanian WW1
boardgame.description:
Romania entered the war in August of 1916, on the Allied side, in an attempt to seize the prize: Transylvania.
This region in Austria-Hungary had a Romanian ethnic majority but was under Hungarian control at the time.
Despite initial successes, the combined forces of Russia and Romania suffered several defeats, and by the end of 1916 only Moldavia remained under Allied control. After several defensive victories in 1917, with different groups competing for authority over the Russian troops in Romania in the aftermath of the October Revolution, Romania signed an armistice at Focani. On November 10, 1918, just one day before the German armistice and when all the other Central Powers had already capitulated, Romania re-entered the war. By then, about 220,000 Romanian soldiers had been killed. Despite their small size, the Germans worried about the prospect of Romania entering the war, Hindenburg writing: “It is certain that so relatively small a state as Romania had never before been given a role so important, and, indeed, so decisive for the history of the world at so favorable a moment.” Romanian soldiers would fight in battles that would be compared with some of the most brutal campaigns on the Western Front at little-known places like the Bran-Câmpulung area, the Carpathains, and the Prahova Valley.

Ownership of ASL-RB, GWASL 1 and all preceding GWASL modules required to play.

Scenarios:

Across The Argesch - Argeș River, Romania, December 3rd 1916
Stand At Brasso - Brassó, Transylvania, October 8th 1916
Sweep Of Cinghinarele Island - Cinghinarele Island, Bulgaria, October 8th 1916
Erich and August - Silistra, Bulgaria, September 4th 1916
Turkey Shooters - Amuzaca, Romania, September 24th 1916
Der Alte Mann - Kohalom, Romania, October 2nd 1916
Saving Moldavia - Oituz, Romania, August 12th 1917
Predeal Ordeal - Predeal,Romania, October 23rd 1916
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: ASL Comp: GWASL XII – With the British in Palestine: British and Irregular
Advanced Squad Leader
ASL Comp: GWASL I – Tankschrecken!
ASL Comp: GWASL II – Blasted Woods: French Great War
ASL Comp: GWASL III – Over There! American Great War
ASL Comp: GWASL IV – Samsonov's Army: Russian Great War
ASL Comp: GWASL IX – Bulgarian Summer: Bulgarian WW1
ASL Comp: GWASL V – Hapsburg Ambitions: Austria-Hungary
ASL Comp: GWASL VI – Blood on the Isonzo: Italian WW1
ASL Comp: GWASL VII – Soldiers of the Sultan: Turkish WW1
ASL Comp: GWASL VIII – Gallipoli and Beyond: ANZAC WW1
ASL Comp: GWASL X – Slavic Warriors: Serbian WW1

boardgame.name: PRIM
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).





Strange things are happening in the Land of the Dead. Instead of reaping souls, Thanatos, the Angel of Death, has to deal with his teenage daughter Prim.Every night, Prim has the same dream: An oddly familiar human boy cries out for her help. Needless to say that our heroine tries to answer the call. There‘s just one tiny problem: The Grim Reaper has strictly forbidden her to enter the Realm of the Living – she‘s not ready for the immense power she‘d develop there, he claims.

Unfortunately, when Prim finds a way to trick her father and travel to Earth, it painfully turns out that Thanatos‘s presentiments have been right all along...

At its core, PRIM is a story of a father learning to let go and a girl finding out who she really is. But it's also a thrilling adventure, full of magic and darkness. On her journey, Prim repeatedly has to switch between the Realm of the Dead and the Land of the Living, where she faces demons, real ones and ones within herself, while always being accompanied by her sidekick, an eye with spider legs.

Key features

Hand drawn HD artwork and traditional frame-by-frame animation
Simple one-click interface
6-8 hours of varied gameplay
Atmospheric orchestral soundtrack
Control multiple characters
In-game hint system, hot-spots and fast-travel
Mini games, such as a deck-building card game


Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Worlds of Universe: Dawn of Terra
boardgame.description:
Worlds of Universe - Survival Board Game / Tabletop is a board game, as well as a miniature game.

What genre is it?
The game is a mix of … Survival, Tabletop Elements, RPG, Crafting, Strategy, Building and Economy. The game is both a co-op and a lone fighter game. For up to 6 players. Despite the complex scope of WoU, the game is also designed to be beginner-friendly. Of course, you will also encounter zombies in the post-apocalypse.

What is WORLDS of UNIVERSE all about?
The story begins in WORLDS of UNIVERSE Teil 1: Dawn of Terra [Part I] on our earth in the year [now]. The only difference is that the fate of the earth was already determined in the 50s. That is with a fallout, justified by a desperate attempt to stop a pandemic. A foreign virus-transformed 60 percent of the population into zombie-like mutant beings.

The humans, as they are, destroyed themselves afterward. The chaos in the new world brings WoU to a post-apocalyptic journey in which players can play their own hero. Due to the disintegration from 1950 onwards, the world in WoU contains both old-fashioned things that have stood still in their time, as well as technical achievements over the years of development.

While some live in the Outland, empires, and elites in their futuristic districts are forging new plans for power over a new unified world. On the other hand, two camps are striving for only one thing; to survive. This is exactly where the players come into play. You are allowed to join one of the camps, do jobs, and advance the main story. And as expected in a zombie survival board game, actually also zombie, mutants, something ugly ?
Note: This game has no connection through the Covid19 events, the content was written by me three years ago. This is pure coincidence.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Roll & Play: The Game Master's Fantasy Toolkit
boardgame.description:
Containing over 120 random tables that are compatible with any fantasy role-playing game, this book is a must-have for game masters everywhere! The concept is simple, either before or during a game go to the table you need, roll the indicated dice (or choose a result) then look up the outcome to produce detailed content with minimal preparation. The book’s wire-bound design means it can lie flat and fit snugly behind your GM Screen, with the rest of your gaming essentials.

What’s inside?

Chapter 1: People and Quests
Character names and behaviours, ally and villain origin stories, organisation names, campaign ideas and more.

Chapter 2: World Building
Town features and local attractions, rumours, bounty posters, taverns, food and drink, festivals, games and more.

Chapter 3: Journeys and Events
Supernatural patrons, ghosts, dreams, traps, as well as encounters across a range of environments.

Chapter 4: Combat and Injuries
Melee, ranged and magic critical hit/fail tables, revival side effects, lasting injuries, diseases, blessings and more.

Chapter 5: Items and Rewards
Magic armour, magic weapons, alchemy misfires, potions, scams, plants, books, art pieces, chest fillers and more.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Roll & Play: The Fantasy Character Kit
boardgame.description:
The book is 168 pages of random tables and content generators. It is packed full of customizable origin stories, magic items, interesting bonds and relationships, fighting styles, arcane focuses, detailed NPCs, and more! It is split into 13 dedicated chapters for all major RPG classes and fantasy character archetypes.

By taking ideas and inspiration from The Fantasy Character Kit, your campaigns will soon be full of memorable characters and unforgettable role-playing moments that will bring a new dimension to your games.

This project follows in the footsteps of our successful Kickstarter project last year, Roll & Play: The Game Master's Fantasy Toolkit, you can check it out here.

Add flavour to your powers, or equip yourself with one of the many magic items available

Wear trophy pelts, feathers and much more in the Barbarians & Mercenaries chapter

By pulling from content across different chapters, you can give characters an unexpected twist – perhaps your party's fighter has impressive musical talents, or your druid uses advanced gadgets to protect the natural world. There are no limits.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Love's Labour's Liberated (Issue 1 - 2020)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The ideals of Chivalry, the power of Enchantment, and the magic of Love deserve a place in your 5th Edition fantasy campaign. To ignite that creative spark on game night, Love's Labour's Liberated introduces several thematically-appropriate variations of 5e mechanics.

Within this zine, you'll find rules for a romance-flavored Cavalier archetype, the Cavalier of Love. A passionate defender of worthy causes, the downtrodden, and a squire-most-handsome as much as any maiden fair, this idealized fighter makes war for love.

Ready to play an Enchanter? Your silver tongue is magical and as spellbinding as the most amorous sonnet; all who meet you want to bask in your presence. For your mage, there's a new spell list that expresses your magics in more evocative ways, and thoughts on how to make your character the paramount paramour.

Beyond archetypes and new spells, there are Magic Items forged in the fires of love and loss. These treasures are powered by the flames of emotion. Enhancing the feel of this project is the the mood-setting poetry of Leland Beauchamp.

But gaming in love is not without peril both in the game and at the gaming table. To that end, there are extensive essays on keeping the game comfortable as you have fun without crossing any lines.

boardgame.name: Wyrd Science (Session Zero - Vol.1/Issue 1 - Jan 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wyrd Science is a new, quarterly, magazine for those exploring the strange worlds and new horizons of roleplaying games, wargames and board games.  

With a focus as much, if not more, on the culture, history and social issues of games as the mechanics of play, Wyrd Science provides a space for games designers, writers and artists to fully unpack their ideas, inspirations and influences and for our writers to dig into both the history of gaming and the issues of today.
boardgame.rpg: Jiangshi: Blood in the Banquet Hall

boardgame.name: Object-Bearer
boardgame.description:
A Wretched & Alone game inspired by "The Lord of the Rings"

Frodo: "I cannot do this alone."
Galadriel: "You are a ring-bearer, Frodo. To bear a ring of power is to be alone. This task was appointed to you. And if you do not find a way, no one will."
- The Fellowship of the Ring


Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Super Fantasy Brawl: Radiant Authority
boardgame.description:
Add to the roster of your Champions with the Radiant Authority! This expansion adds King Alistair, Khalize, and Sir Tentaclot to your Champions.

King Alistair, The Scaled Tyrant, takes lots of damage, deals lots of damage and helps around the board. The Black-hearted draconian is a great leader, shining in various roles!

Khalize, The Will of the Heavens, will cover the Champions in her radiant power in the Arena and grant her allies considerable strength. A true ally for everyone on he side!

Sir Tentaclot, The Paladin of Madness, carries himself around like a corrupt, evil Arthurian knight. He is feared by his opponents, and his power is poisonous!
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Super Fantasy Brawl

boardgame.name: Tate and State
boardgame.description:
Players take turns throwing dice with the values of a smiley face, T, A, t, E, S (in order of decreasing value) and try to score the best combination. The first player can stop at one throw or re-throw all or some of the dice. Other player can only have as many throws as the first player.

Some combinations are:

'Enterprise': Smiley face and TAtE (Best combination)
'Five of a kind'
'Four of a kind' and so on
'Stagnation': STAtE (losing throw, player pays penalty)

This game seemed to have been produced by Tate and Lyle sugar refineries to protest against nationalization of the sugar refining industry.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Envyra: Infinity
boardgame.description:
Infinity is the utmost expansion for the Envyra game. Like with other Envyra expansions, it is easy to implement with only a few seconds needed to understand the rules.
Envyra remains the same fast and clever simultaneous action game, but now with even more options and infinite fun.

Infinity expansion is compatible with all other Envyra expansions. Not playable in ANDRENALINE MODE.

- - - - - - -

CONTENT:
1 Infinity Tile
2 Wild Tiles

SETUP:
After the tiles are sorted during the setup (step 1), mix 2 Wild Tiles with other 'S' marked Tiles and mix 1 Infinity Tile with other (Basic) Tiles.

- - -

RULES (Infinity Tile):
Infinity Tile is very special. Cubes placed on this tile are never to be returned to their owners during the game (except the situation when all player's cubes are removed from the Grid).
The player can target the Infinity Tile during Phase I only if this player is targeting another eligible tile with their second cube as well. That means the player cannot target the Infinity Tile with a single cube placement in Phase I.
Be careful not to place your cubes on this tile too early as you may have very limited capturing options for the rest of the game.

Scoring:
The player with the most cubes on Infinity Tile at the end of the game adds 8 points to their total. If more players have the most cubes (same number) placed on the Infinity Tile, they each gain 8 points divided by the number of tied players rounded down (i.e. each of two tied players gets 4 points, each of three tied players gets 2 points, etc.).

- - -

RULES (Wild Tiles):
Wild Tiles belong to all three themes (Green/Blue/Orange). The solar system symbol is unique to all three themes (the Fifth Symbol). Wild Tile could be captured by the player like any other tile.
The owner of the tile can choose which theme this tile belongs to and they can change this theme/color affiliation each round. That means Wild Tile can help the player acquire restricted tiles with different theme icons each round. Note that the Wild Tile could represent only one theme/color each round.

Example:
There are two restricted tiles in the Playing Grid. The first restricted tile displays 1 green and 2 orange icons on the right side and the second tile displays 1 blue, 1 green, and 1 orange icon. A player owns 1 green tile and 2 Wild Tiles thus this player is eligible to move their cube on any of these restricted tiles, but it can't move their cube on both during the same round.

Scoring:
During the scoring, a player can choose again which theme their Wild Tile would belong to and add a unique solar system symbol to the set of that theme/color.
The Black Star symbol with the '-2' VP mark means that the player owning the tile must deduct 2 VP points from their total during scoring.

—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Envyra

boardgame.name: Whac-a-Mole Match-a-Mole
boardgame.description: Whac-a-Mole Match-a-Mole is a fast-paced matching and smacking game where players take turns revealing cards from their decks until they spot a match between the color and icon of the face up cards and the mole tile in the center of the table. When that happens, players race to hit the center mole tile with their mole smacker. A small suction cup under the mole smacker will pick up the mole tile. The player to successfully collect the tile keeps it. When all the tiles have been collected, the player with the most mole tiles wins.

boardgame.name: Krampusnacht
boardgame.description:
Every culture that celebrates Christmas has their own unique traditions. Scandinavians have the yule goat. Germans originated the Christmas tree.

And Austrians? Austrians have the Krampus.

Built using the Wretched and Alone system, Krampusnacht is a single-player journaling game in which a naughty child tries their best to avoid a grisly punishment at the hands of a demonic goat-person. To play, you'll need a writing implement, a six-sided die, a block tower, a deck of playing cards, and a stomach for a bit of dark whimsy.

Will it turn out well for you? Probably not. But all you need is a few good days...

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Lost in the Deep
boardgame.description:
You are the last survivor of a band of dwarven warriors who have come to the lost halls of the Kingdom Under the Mother Mountain, to retake it and rebuild it in the name of your ancestors. After months of wandering the almost endless halls of the dwarven ruins, your band unwittingly set free an ancient evil that lay asleep for generations, and one-by-one, it killed your companions in the most terrifying ways possible.

Now you are lost in the depths of earth, registering your history in the diary of your people. You search for an exit from the mines, but all you can find are endless halls and the damned creatures serving that Evil in the Shadows that awakened and destroyed your people.

Everyday you count your last remaining torches and meals, wander through the infinite halls and mines, and write your memories in your diary. Everyday you feel the evil entity and its minions coming closer and closer. The drums of its chaos army beat faster and faster. You don’t have much time.

Can you reach the surface before the ancient evil finds you? Was a rescue party sent to find you? Will your food and water last as long as you need to reach the doors to freedom? Or will you die of starvation in the depths of the mountain?

All you know is that you’re lost in the deep...

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Zoo-ography: The Card Game
boardgame.description: In Zoo-ography, you've been asked to design a new city zoo. Build custom habitats, hand pick animals for exhibits, and strategically place attractions to bring visitors to your zoo. Meet each city's unique set of objectives to earn the highest rated zoo!
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Versions & Editions: Card Versions of Non-Card Games
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Zoo-ography: Connections

boardgame.name: Berlin I: Final Victory
boardgame.description:
Berlin Final Victory HUGE MONSTER Edition: Crazy, big, massive, enlarged, and unprecedented. Those would be terms one could use to describe the Battle of Berlin. You might also want to trot them out for a description of this new edition of Berlin I, an unusual and unique gaming experience-the first truly large hex city fight. What you get is an enlarged (check our site for actual dimensions, it aims at as Deluxe as can be considering the huge scale of this battlefield) game map using the new lay-flat, hard boards. It's just mind-blowing to look at, the expanse. You also receive the scenario collection in latest editions in color + new color rules pages in 3-hole, the new presentation. Bring your own counters from any edition or purchase the BERLIN COUNTER SET now available. You also get the collection of color play aids in NEW cardstock format for durability and ease of use.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Berlin II: Führer's End
Advanced Squad Leader

boardgame.name: Capital Punishment: The Party Argument Game
boardgame.description:
This is the party game that puts pop culture on trial. In our deck of cards, you’ll find the names of hundreds of celebrities, politicians, and pop culture trends. You have one goal—to convince the Judge and the other players that your card is the worst one on the table. Brush up on your lawyer skills.

See you in court.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Palimpsest
boardgame.description:
We live and work above layers and layers of history, of art, of culture often unknown to us. Sandwiched in between the remnants of bloody wars are the relics of a peaceful stretch of history. The architectural prowess of one civilization gives way to the simple construction of homes as technology is lost. Traditions get passed down, changing through time as one group passes them on to the next. These form a palimpsest of history, diverse layers hiding beneath the surface we see every day.

Palimpsest is a game about creating and discovering the development of civilizations across thousands of years, and understanding how one led to the other. You and a few others will be collaboratively creating concepts for civilizations, taking on Lenses of them, explaining how they faded, how they came to be, and how ideas get re-contextualized from one to the next.

You'll be connecting these civilizations to each other by leaving behind artifacts, relics, traditions and ideas for the next civilization, and building subsequent civilizations based on what you leave behind.

Palimpsest is a 28-page full color book, based on “I’m Sorry Did You Say Street Magic” by Caro Asercion

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Wild Robot's Checker Set
boardgame.description:
Standard Checkers rules with a robot for each player. The Robot is placed next to the board on each player's end. On any turn a player may move the robot in one of the following ways:

To enter the board, the robot must jump in and capture an enemy piece. The robot may choose to not jump in if the opportunity arises. A robot that jumped in must complete the full series of jumps capturing enemy pieces to the extent that it is able to do so. A robot may jump in and jump out again in one turn.
A robot moves like a standard king on the board.
A robot may jump off the board by capturing an enemy piece and landing off the board, or by moving from a square on the perimeter of the board. A robot may not jump out of the board even if there is the opportunity to do so.
To re-enter the board a robot jumps in again according to rule no. 1 above

boardgame.name: The City Sewers (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is an adventure for 5th Edition Dungeons and Dragons.

Danger lurks in every city in the realm. But beneath the city streets lies a world far more dangerous than the streets above. People who venture into this world are often never heard from again.

Almost every major city has a sewer system. The one provided in this adventure is usable in just about any fantasy city. It is a series of connecting tunnels that can be used in just about any order. They are interchangeable and one can include or exclude them as needed.

There are several parts to this adventure for different levels of challenge. Many different adventures into the sewer system could be done at various stages of character development.

boardgame.name: The City Sewers (OSRIC)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is an OSRIC adventure.

Danger lurks in every city in the realm. But beneath the city streets lies a world far more dangerous than the streets above. People who venture into this world are often never heard from again.

Almost every major city has a sewer system. The one provided in this adventure is usable in just about any fantasy city. It is a series of connecting tunnels that can be used in just about any order. They are interchangeable and one can include or exclude them as needed.

There are several parts to this adventure for different levels of challenge. Many different adventures into the sewer system could be done at various stages of character development.
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: A Rainbow of Slimes
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Although green is the most common slime color, there are many others, the products of alchemy, magic, demonic corruption, trickster gods, and a variety of bizarre causes!

This mini-supplement describes 20 variations on the classic dungeon hazard, each of which has a different effect on living flesh, some of them using this transformation to power magical or non-magical abilities.

“A Rainbow of Slimes” also includes 10 different colors of counters, each in two sizes, that can be used to represent various types and sizes of slimes, molds, oozes, puddings, jellies, blobs, fungi, and other amorphous abominations.

boardgame.name: Battle Amber
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Turmoil grips a low tech planet as one of its nobles embarks on a spree of conquest using a wondrous substance he recently came into possession of. The same substance which rumors have reached the ambitious CEO of an interstellar company, who sends the PCs to fetch for him. But the heroes quickly discover that “primitive” doesn't mean “stupid”, and in fact can instead mean “deadly.”

Battle Amber is a short adventure for Cepheus Engine and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game.

boardgame.name: Lumber Town (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tired of your towns and cities being boring, bland places in which your PCs show little or no interest? Want to bring them alive with cool, interesting minor features of note? Then Urban Dressing is for you! Each instalment in the line focuses on a different kind of town and gives harried GMs the tools to bring such locales to life with interesting and noteworthy features.

This instalment of Urban Dressing presents loads of great details to customise the pirate towns in your campaign.

This Urban Dressing presents:

One table (100 entries) presenting the town's sights and sounds.
One table (100 entries) presenting sample businesses.
One table (100 entries) presenting folk to encounter around town.
One table (20 entries) presenting hooks, complications and opportunities.

boardgame.name: Lumber Town (OSR)
boardgame.description:

Tired of your towns and cities being boring, bland places in which your PCs show little or no interest? Want to bring them alive with cool, interesting minor features of note? One table (20 entries) presenting hooks, complications and opportunities.

One table (100 entries) presenting the town's sights and sounds.
One table (100 entries) presenting sample businesses.
One table (100 entries) presenting folk to encounter around town.
One table (20 entries) presenting hooks, complications and opportunities.

boardgame.name: Hunt
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

There's strength in numbers, and when your world is overrun with bio-mutants you'll need all the help you can get. Solve the mystery. Recruit another settlement. Survive the Pharmapocalypse!

This adventure can be run as a standalone or as a series to Pharmapocalypse: Escape and Shelter. Play them separate or together, it's all good!

boardgame.name: Yamal Diamonds
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You dive into the dark, rough waters, the surface disappears as you get closer to the bottom.
The wreck is there, filled with treasures.
But the Ocean is terrible and won't let you steal it so easily...

Every Monday, discover a new monster and its quick plot-hook : a psychic parasite, a cursed item, a monstrous insect....

"Monsters of the Week" is a series of scenario, quick to read and to add to your play nights, whether to complete an ongoing campaign, to start one or simply for a one-shot !
They are not written for a specific system or universe in order to let you modify and develop them at will.

Contains

a quick-to-read plot-hook,
exclusive illustration for the monster,
a description of the creature.



Vous plongez dans les eaux sombres et agitées, la surface disparaît à mesure que vous vous approchez du fond.
L’épave est là, remplie de trésors.
Mais l’Océan est terrible et ne vous laissera pas le voler si facilement...

Chaque semaine, découvrez un nouveau monstre accompagnez de son amorce de scénario : un parasite psychique, un objet maudit, un insecte monstrueux...

"Monsters of the Week" est une série de scénarios rapide à lire et à incorporer dans vos soirées de jeux, que ce soit pour compléter une campagne, en commencer une ou simplement pour un one-shot !
Ils ne sont pas écrits pour un système ou un univers en particulier afin de vous permettre de les modifier et les développer à volonté.

Contient :

une amorce de scénario rapide à lire,
une illustration exclusive du monstre,
une description de la créature.

boardgame.name: Natalia's Guide to Necromancy
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Natalia's Guide to Necromancy is a 'zine-size (39 pages) 5e supplement of necromancers, vampires, and ghouls! With the guidance of Natalia Vlatla, your minion master necromancer will be able to reanimate large-size undead, command specters and wraiths, and sculpt their corporeal minions into deadly abominations with phalanges carved into razor sharp claws, bloated bellies swollen with acid that pop and cover nearby enemies when they're slain, or ghastly extended limbs that allow them to tower twelve feet over the battlefield.

Take the new dhampir race to play as a mortal half-cursed with undeath, inheriting a few of your undead progenitor's vampiric powers while still being able to stand the light of day, or embrace the thirst altogether and become a full-on vampire, attuning to your own awakened blood as though it were a magic item to unlock more and more vampiric powers: Hypnotism, transformation, preternatural physical and mental abilities, and more. But beware: Once you have embraced your stolen blood, you can never go back, and as your powers mount, so too will your weaknesses.

There's more than one path to undeath. Return from the dead as a ghoul, and you will constantly search for living flesh to consume in order to prevent yourself from rotting away. But there are many rituals help make your self-preservation more manageable: Scoop your organs out into canopic jars, attach bolts to your temples and charge yourself with lightning, or just give yourself a terrible, unholy feast of a dozen or more fresh corpses and let that keep you ghoulishly perky for a few weeks.

And there's more! Scythe-wielding Paladins of the Eternal Oath, curse-casting Necromancers of the School of the Reaper, new spells, new feats, action-oriented undead bosses, and all manner of undeath and terror!

boardgame.name: Circus Moris
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book (translated from Norwegian):

Circus Moris describes one of the most brutal aspects of human society and entertainment in the empire, namely the Imperial Violent Circus.

boardgame.name: Class Acts: Volume 1
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Humans and dwarves, little folk and elves, beings of all creeds and colors! Krepolegion’s Magic Warehouse proudly brings to you its first of a collection of archétypes de classe for the 5th edition of one of the oldest and greatest roleplaying games in the WORLD …

Within this tome you will find three newly discovered character class archetypes for Players to use in their campaigns (with your GMs approval, of course):

Dominion Domain (Cleric)
Circle of the Lost (Druid)
Way of Many Forms (Monk)

boardgame.name: Class Acts: Volume 2
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Humans and dwarves, little folk and elves, beings of all creeds and colors! Krepolegion’s Magic Warehouse proudly brings to you its second of a collection of archétypes de classe for the 5th edition of one of the oldest and greatest roleplaying games in the WORLD …

Within this tome you will find three newly discovered character class archetypes for Players to use in their campaigns (with your GMs approval, of course):

Path of the Colossus (Barbarian)
College of Adjuration (Bard)
Archer Conclave (Ranger)

boardgame.name: Class Acts: Volume 3
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Humans and dwarves, little folk and elves, beings of all creeds and colors! Krepolegion’s Magic Warehouse proudly brings to you its third of a collection of archétypes de classe for the 5th edition of one of the oldest and greatest roleplaying games in the WORLD …

Within this tome you will find three newly discovered character class archetypes for Players to use in their campaigns (with your GMs approval, of course):

Ritual Warrior (Fighter)
The Green Star (Sorcerer)
THe Gravetouched (Warlock)

boardgame.name: Catalogue of Wondrous Treasures: Volume 1
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Humans and dwarves, little folk and elves, beings of all creeds and colors! Krepolegion’s Magic Warehouse proudly brings to you its first volume of objets de magie for the 5th edition of one of the oldest and greatest roleplaying games in the WORLD …

Within this tome you will find over two dozen newly discovered magical items and artifacts for GMs to add to their campaigns:

Ammunition of Unraveling
Armor of Altair
Baldric of Weaponry
Banner of Bravery
Bow of the Sylvan Lords
Bowl of Sustenance
Bracers of the Blinding Strike
Collar of Truth
Dust of Paralyzation
Goblynvogt
Gravity Hammer
Hammer of Hephaestus
Heavenly Sword
Horn of Hypnos
Ice Cube
Key of Security
Medallion of Defense
Moonlight Greatsword
Pearl of Might
Pearl of Puissance
Potion of Numbing
Ranger’s Ring
Ring of Extended Warmth
Roman Candle
Staff of Force
Sword of Mercy
Wand of Wondrous Bread
Wizard’s Ring
Wraps of the Jötunn

boardgame.name: Catalogue of Wondrous Treasures: Volume 2
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Humans and dwarves, little folk and elves, beings of all creeds and colors! Krepolegion’s Magic Warehouse proudly brings to you its second volume of objets de magie for the 5th edition of one of the oldest and greatest roleplaying games in the WORLD …

Within this tome you will find over two dozen newly discovered magical items and artifacts for GMs to add to their campaigns:

Ægishjálmr
Aphrodite’s Dagger
Armbands of Might
Bard’s Ring
Bead of Little Impact
Bow of Steadiness
Charlatan’s Ring
Expandable Ladder
Flatbox
Gauntlets of Proficiency
Keller’s Walking Staff
Lantern of Infinite Burning
Magic Markers
Monk’s Ring
Potion of Dumb Luck
Potion of Luck
Ring of Health
Rocksplitter
Sorcerer’s Ring
Still-Beating Heart
Tome of Recording
Totem Kilt
Wand of Focus
Weapon of Disruption
Whetstone of Sharpness
Winged Hammer

boardgame.name: Catalogue of Wondrous Treasures: Volume 3
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Humans and dwarves, little folk and elves, beings of all creeds and colors! Krepolegion’s Magic Warehouse proudly brings to you its third volume of objets de magie for the 5th edition of one of the oldest and greatest roleplaying games in the WORLD …

Within this tome you will find over two dozen newly discovered magical items and artifacts for GMs to add to their campaigns:

Ammunition of Piercing
Armor of Iron Will
Band of Ivy
Barbarian’s Ring
Bedroll of Restful Slumber
Boots of Comfort
Broom of Cleanliness
Carpet of Cleanliness
Cherlindrea’s Wand
Cloak of Vanishing
Crushing Weapon
Duggery’s Skull
Egg of Tricks
Gáe Bulg
Gargoyle Cloak
Marshortin’s Energetic Ammunition
Marshortin’s Random Potion
Marshortin’s Wand of Wonder
Oil of Armor
Paladin’s Ring
Pariapt of Absorption
Pillow of Recuperation
Potion of Sustenance
Quiver of Returning
Ring of Affliction
Seal of Shlomoh
Spade of Eternal Rest
Wabbajack
Weapon, Wooden

boardgame.name: The Dread Womb (MYZ)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fear Comes for You!

The Dread Womb is in full production...can you overcome your terror? A simple contract investigating disappearances in the settlement of Telsix will expose you to a darker side of the colony's secret past. Telsix ever progresses forward as a leader in AI research, but a blend of technology and madness haunts every scientific advance. On the outskirts of the colony sits a former scientific research facility, but it is now little more than a condemned junkyard. This landfill is the site of recent disappearances and disturbances, and now outsiders must discover the truth behind these events .. and what they will find is grim and grisly...

The Dread Womb is a Mutant Year Zero compatible adventure. Feel free to use Dread Womb in conjunction with any other Mutant Year Zero campaign. Expect 6-10 hours of gameplay, depending on your play style.

The Dread Womb includes:

A 20+ page adventure, which should take 6-10 hours to complete.
New technology and gear
7 new Mutant Year Zero compatible adversaries.
An adventure flowchart to help GMs plot the course of the story

boardgame.name: Merchants of the Dark Road: Patron's Provisions
boardgame.description:
Be extra prepared for every part of your journey on the Dark Road, including deluxe steed tiles and the Watchers' Words mini-expansion module.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Merchants of the Dark Road

listing.notes: The game is brand new it has the basic version with cardboard money and the patrons provision wich include - 4 merchant coin pouches - lumi metal coins (metal as well as resin lanterns and crystals ) - as well as bonus cards for the solo campain I will accept a trade for Rising sun

boardgame.name: GLarg! 33.3 Year Anniversary Reprint
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

GLarg! was my fanzine which ran to 10 issues between 1985 and 1989. When I heard about Zine Quest on Kickstarter I decided to do a 'Best of' with some of the best and worst bits of the issues I could still find. This is that 'Best of' which also happened to be the third of a century anniversary of the first issue.

boardgame.name: El Futbolero
boardgame.description:
El Futbolero is a board game about soccer. Exclusively for those who know football, it brings a thousand questions with options to answer and test what you know. Local, international, UEFA, AFA, Libertadores, FIFA, World clubs and sports anecdotes: everything is covered in this game for fans.

It is also a strategy game because with each correct answer a goal is scored on the board. The objective is to form two goal lines on the board, lining up 4 balls.

It can be played individually or in teams.

boardgame.name: Grimm Encounters II
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Twelve Terrifying Encounters for your Campaign

If you need some horrifying and grotesque encounters for your table, look no further. This supplement is filled with 12 haunting encounters based on classic fairy tales from the Grimm Brothers and their contemporaries. These encounters are perfect for dropping into horror themed games, those set in Ravenloft or the Shadowfell, or for your yearly Halloween Special!

boardgame.name: Grimm Encounters III
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Ten Terrifying Encounters for your Campaign

If you need some horrifying and grotesque encounters for your table, look no further. This supplement is filled with ten haunting encounters based on classic fairy tales from the Grimm Brothers and their contemporaries. These encounters are perfect for dropping into horror themed games, those set in Ravenloft or the Shadowfell, or for your yearly Halloween Special!

boardgame.name: Sefirot
boardgame.description:
Sefirot is an ancient game from the lost lands of Dioscoria. Played in numerous variations on different boards with Tarot cards, higher powers will decide upon the players’ destiny, their triumph or their downfall.

In its solitaire version a world spanning tree of life becomes the stage for the player’s challenges of the fates themselves, trying to overcome the universe’s perilous duality of growth and decay.

The game can also be played together, in numerous modes for two people: they might battle for the stars themselves or embark on a tender dance that will reveal their joined faith.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: El Señor Dix
boardgame.description: El Señor Dix is a card game that invites you to think and associate. It has two decks: one for drawings and the other for qualities. To play with children from 4 years old, and with different levels of difficulty, the drawings must be associated with one or more characteristics to accumulate cards and win the game.

boardgame.name: The Dee Sanction
The Dee Sanction Core Rules: Adventures in Covert Enochian Intelligence
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

In 1564, Queen Elizabeth appended the Dee Sanction to her Act Against Conjurations. An agency dedicated to protecting England from the supernatural was born.

You are an Agent of Dee; not out of choice, but out of some twisted sense of self-preservation. Somewhere between conscription and penance, you work for the occultist and scholar Doctor John Dee to make amends, with a faint hope that you can use your talents to earn your pardon and absolution.

The Dee Sanction is a standalone game of tabletop adventure in a divergent world of Covert Enochian Intelligence - where the forces at work against the ascendancy of Elizabethan power draw on the primal and malevolent forces of the supernatural.
boardgame.rpghonor: 2021 UK Games Expo Best Role-playing Game Judges Award Winner

listing.notes: This is for the limited edition Kick Starter hard cover version of the rules.

boardgame.name: El Pasajero
boardgame.description: El Pasajero is the perfect game to have in the glove compartment of the car. It consists of two decks of 40 cards, one for the route and one for the city, with illustrations that children must find looking through the window. It can be played alone, in teams, or among all the passengers. The best antidote to long journeys and the "how far to go ?!".

boardgame.name: Granny's Garden
boardgame.description:
An Official Tunnels & Trolls Mini-Solo

From the introduction:

It's a sunny normal day in the city of Lakeview and you're out on a stroll, minding your own business when a sharp tart voice plucks you out of your reverie.

boardgame.name: Once Upon a Harvest Eve
boardgame.description:
An Official Tunnels & Trolls Halloween Solo

From the introduction:

Every year the bloated moon rises on the Fall Harvest, and the veil between this world and the realms beyond thins. Things of unspeakable horror breech into normal folks land and wreak horror and death on an unsuspecting and defenseless people.

boardgame.name: Solo Codex: A Collection of Fantasy Gaming Solos
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Within this fabulous collection of text based Fantasy Gaming Solo's you will find the following solo's: Hobbitville Solo, Slaying the Minotaur Solo, Adventure in Khazan Solo, Khazan Sewers Solo and The Wild-Weird West Solo. Each solo is unique unto itself and each solo can be played as a stand alone solo.

boardgame.name: UNO: Rick & Morty
boardgame.description:
Rick and Morty UNO Card Game [Adult Swim] including Special Rule Mr. Meeseeks Fun Gift.

If you know Rick and Morty, then you know that rules aren’t really their thing. So, in Rick and Morty Uno, the typical game we all know and love has a rule-breaking twist. The Mr. Meeseeks Rule lets you search through the discard pile to find the perfect card to play should you not have one that works.

boardgame.name: The Book of Ascention
boardgame.description:
The Heroes Rise to the Final Level

From the back of the book:

This book contains over 100 pages of information needed to take your characters beyond the standard d20 Core Rules level cap and rocket them into the realm of epic adventures and eventually possible godhood.

boardgame.name: The Game of Life: Disney Parks – Theme Park Edition
boardgame.description:
Here you leave today and enter the world of yesterday, tomorrow and fantasy. Welcome to the Disney Parks! Be our guest as you venture through all the wonder and excitement that the Disney Parks have to offer in this special Theme Park Edition of The Game of LIFE.

Magic in the details
Your Disney Parks Guide will be there as you wish upon a star, but beware, a Disney Villain may cast a spell and rain on your parade. Make all your wishes come true and bring the magic and memories home to your own castle in the sky.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Versions & Editions: Disney Theme Park Editions

boardgame.name: ASL Comp: GWASL XII – With the British in Palestine: British and Irregular
boardgame.description:
One of the most compelling theaters in the history of warfare was the Middle East during the Great War. From late 1914 until mid-1915, the British defend the Suez Canal, taking on various Turkish and Senussi irregulars in their attempts to capture or damage the canal, to block it. A major victory was earned in August 1916, at Rumani, near the coast. This success relieved pressure on the Suez Canal. The British then began to construct a railway and supply roads along the coast. Operations continued against the Senussi in the Western Desert. This part of the campaign saw Sollum shelled by German U-Boats, and an Emergency Squadron of the Royal Naval Armoured Car Division sent to strengthen the British post there. Both Sollum and Sidi Barrani were subjected to Arab raids. The 2nd New Zealand Rifle Brigade, one company of 15th Sikhs, a detachment of the Bikanir Camel Corps, an Egyptian Army Machine Gun Section and an armoured train garrisoned by 1/10th Ghurka Rifles, moved on 21 December 1915 to hold the Alexandria - Debaa railway, and to patrol to the Moghara oasis against more Senussi incursions. Battles would rage back and forth at places like Matruh, Sidi Barrani, made famous later, when the Desert Fox Erwin Rommel enter the annals of military history. The Senussi were finally defeated with the use of modern weaponry including armored cars, aircraft and artillery.

Ownership ASL-RB, GWASL 1 and all preceding GWASL modules required to play.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Advanced Squad Leader
ASL Comp: GWASL I – Tankschrecken!
ASL Comp: GWASL II – Blasted Woods: French Great War
ASL Comp: GWASL III – Over There! American Great War
ASL Comp: GWASL IV – Samsonov's Army: Russian Great War
ASL Comp: GWASL IX – Bulgarian Summer: Bulgarian WW1
ASL Comp: GWASL V – Hapsburg Ambitions: Austria-Hungary
ASL Comp: GWASL VI – Blood on the Isonzo: Italian WW1
ASL Comp: GWASL VII – Soldiers of the Sultan: Turkish WW1
ASL Comp: GWASL VIII – Gallipoli and Beyond: ANZAC WW1
ASL Comp: GWASL X – Slavic Warriors: Serbian WW1
ASL Comp: GWASL XI – Balkan Aspirations: Romanian WW1

boardgame.name: Midnight Goblin Solo Gamebook - Hero Kids Compatible
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

Play as a Goblin! Choose to be good or evil. Your choices will determine whether the goblins make peace with the humans, or go to war!

Go on a quest to steal an important artifact from the human village of Greenfalls. The goblin chief is counting on you to cause chaos. When you arrive to the village, however, you learn that the humans are not the evil monsters that you believed them to be. What will you do? Will you listen to your goblin chief, and steal the artifact anyway, causing a war? Or will you do what you can to make peace with the humans? THE CHOICE IS YOURS!

Based on the fantasy gamebooks that were popular in the 80's and 90's, this book allows you to make multiple choices and decisions about how your adventure unfolds. Have a few dice ready as you roll for skill checks and combat encounters.

Designed for kids 10+ to read on their own. Parents can also read the book to a younger child and have the child make decisions in the story and roll dice.
FEATURES:

1) 5 possible endings to the main storyline.

2) 5 different goblin classes/character builds to choose from.

3) Choose 1 of 6 skills for your goblin. Some of these skills, such as lock picking, open up additional options/choices in the narrative.

4) The village of Greenfalls can be explored in any order you wish, as you search for clues to find a dwarven artifact.

5) Two books, The History of Greenfalls Volume 1 and 2, can be discovered and read. It will take two playthroughs to find both books.

6) More sections/gamebook paragraphs than any of our other solo gamebooks yet!

Requires the Hero Kids core rulebook to play.

Hero Kids is a trademark of Justin Halliday and is used with permission. No challenge is intended.

boardgame.name: Shiki
boardgame.description:
Shiki is a card game with dice, an ideal combination for children who are entering the world of board games.

Seasons cards are dealt: Winter, Spring, Summer and Autumn. On each turn, one player rolls the die to mark the station in play. Whoever threw it will discard all the cards that he has from that station. The rest of the players also play! They will be discarded from a single card from that station. The first one to run out of cards in hand, advances one place on the board. The first to cross the victory line will be the winner.

boardgame.name: The Game of Life: Disney Pixar Inside Out
boardgame.description:
Experience The Game of LIFE from the Inside Out!
Based on the popular Disney Pixar film Inside Out, this special edition of The Game of LIFE takes fans on a journey through the mind of an 11-year-old girl named Riley. Guided by her five emotions; Joy, Sadness, Disgust, Anger, and Fear, players must travel through the subconscious mind to regain core memories and bring them back to Headquarters. The player with the most memory points wins! Great collectible item for Pixar fans and fun for family game nights.

boardgame.name: Atenea
boardgame.description: Atenea is a general culture trivia game. There are four reversible boards and each locker determines a theme. With the dice, cross the board answering the questions of the topics that you go through. But beware! Not everything is so linear! In "Lions" they will not only ask you about the king of the jungle, you can also find a hockey team or a Russian politician!

boardgame.name: Scrabble: Disney Vacation Club
boardgame.description:
"Welcome Home" to a special Disney Vacation Club Edition of SCRABBLE, America's favorite word game. Your magical community has inspired a variety of neighborhood twists on the classic game, creating a unique SCRABBLE experience that spells pure.... MEMBERSHIP MAGIC.

—description from the back of the box

boardgame.name: El Tiburón
boardgame.description:
El Tiburón is a board game for the youngest of the house illustrated by Isol. An opportunity to learn to play board games. And have fun in the path!

We have four fish tanks full of animals that we have to release into the ocean. But beware! A shark is on the prowl! We roll the dice. This shows us which animal we have to release into the ocean or which animal the shark eats...

If there are no animals left in the tanks, and the shark is not full, you win. If the shark eats 6 animals before you release all of them to the ocean, you lose.

A simple and educational game so that the youngest of the house learn to play board games: to be patient, to follow rules, to cooperate other.
